TITLE: Investor home purchases jump for the first time in two years. Here's what that means for buyers
SUMMARY: Real estate investor activity picked up for the first time in nearly two years. Here's what it means for buyers, and even renters, on the market.

TITLE: 5 ways to maximize your vacation days
SUMMARY: American workers have less paid time off than those in many other countries, and tend not to use all their vacation days.

TITLE: The average 401(k) savings rate recently hit a record — how to know if you're on track
SUMMARY: The average 401(k) savings rate recently hit a record high. Here's how it compares with the recommended retirement savings rate.

TITLE: Harvard fellow: CFPB's 'buy now, pay later' regulation isn't enough — nothing 'substantively changes'
SUMMARY: Many BNPL providers already comply with the agency's new guidance. A bigger issue is that these loans still aren't reflected in credit reports, one expert says.

TITLE: Don't be so quick to take money advice from TikTok — here's why
SUMMARY: There is no substitute for establishing a budget you can sustain over time, experts say.

TITLE: What to do if you think you're underpaid
SUMMARY: Only 34% of Americans are satisfied with how much they are paid at work, according to a March 2023 Pew Research Center survey. Here's how you can earn more.

TITLE: Hurricane season will bring 4 to 7 major storms, NOAA predicts. How to prevent catastrophic damage to your home
SUMMARY: Scientists are forecasting "above-normal" activity for this year's hurricane season. How to prepare your home, as hurricane damage can be costly.

TITLE: Mega backdoor Roth conversions can be a 'no brainer' for higher earners, expert says
SUMMARY: Mega backdoor Roth conversions can boost retirement savings for higher earners. Here's what to know about the strategy.

TITLE: Why job skills could make or break your next interview
SUMMARY: Employers are moving away from traditional job filters, such as education and years of experience, in favor of "skills-based hiring."

TITLE: Here's why the minimum wage and some tax breaks don't budge despite inflation
SUMMARY: The minimum wage and financial thresholds tied to things like Social Security taxes don't change along with the cost of living.

TITLE: IRS free tax filing program to be available nationwide starting in 2025
SUMMARY: The IRS will expand Direct File, its free tax filing program, nationwide starting in 2025, the agency and the U.S. Department of the Treasury announced.

TITLE: Hiring stays strong for low earners, Vanguard finds
SUMMARY: Labor demand has been resilient for lower earners while waning for higher-paying jobs, according to a new analysis.

TITLE: 37% of Americans paid a late fee in the last 12 months, report finds
SUMMARY: More than one-third of Americans have recently fallen behind on a bill, such as credit cards, utilities or rent, according to NerdWallet. Here's what to do.

TITLE: 3 reasons why it may be time to break up with your financial advisor — and how to do it
SUMMARY: If you are wondering whether it is time to move on from your financial advisor, here are three factors you may want to consider.

TITLE: Student loan debt may prevent retirement security for millions of older workers, research finds
SUMMARY: Millions of older Americans' ability to save for retirement may be threatened by unpaid student loan debt, according to new research.

TITLE: This retirement planning gap is 'hidden in plain sight,' Harvard professor says
SUMMARY: Retirement planning often focuses on money. But investing in strong social connections is arguably just as important.

TITLE: A private arts college is set to close, citing issues with the new FAFSA. Others may follow, expert warns
SUMMARY: Citing too few students, the Delaware College of Art and Design will no longer offer classes or confer degrees starting this fall.

TITLE: As if! 'Clueless' star Alicia Silverstone avoids buying retail to limit environmental toll: 'It needs to be used first'
SUMMARY: Online shopping, and returning, exacts a hefty environmental toll. Sustainability advocate Alicia Silverstone avoids buying new if she can help it.

TITLE: ‘It’s already highway robbery.’ Why people don’t wait to claim Social Security and what experts say
SUMMARY: Delaying Social Security retirement benefits provides a guaranteed return unmatched elsewhere. Yet many are hesitant to take advantage of it.

TITLE: Roth conversions are up in 2024 — but it's not always a 'slam dunk,' accountant says
SUMMARY: There's an uptick in Roth conversions in 2024, according to Fidelity Investments. Here's how to know if the strategy is right for your portfolio.

TITLE: 25% of consumers recently used a buy now, pay later loan, report finds. What to know as they become popular
SUMMARY: Buy now, pay later loans are the second-most used form of credit payment among U.S. consumers in the U.S., NerdWallet found. But changes are on the horizon.

TITLE: Some Asian American and Pacific Islander women face a $1 million salary shortfall due to the pay gap
SUMMARY: Asian American, Native Hawaiian and Pacific Islander women work 15 months to earn what a white man makes in a year, the National Women's Law Center found.

TITLE: You could score a tax break for hiring your own kids this summer — if you follow the rules
SUMMARY: Hiring your kids can offer tax benefits if you're self-employed. But first, you need to understand your state and federal labor and tax laws.

TITLE: Cash discounts, while still rare, are up over 60% from 2015. Here's how much you can save
SUMMARY: More merchants are giving discounts to consumers who pay with cash, or putting surcharges on credit card purchases.

TITLE: Why groceries are so expensive — and how consumers may start to see relief
SUMMARY: To save money on groceries now, experts say consumers may have to change their shopping habits. That may mean seeking out cheap grocery stores.

TITLE: 'Pregnancy discrimination across corporate America is still rampant,' author says
SUMMARY: In the book, "Women Money Power," financial journalist Josie Cox tells the story of women's fight for financial equality.

TITLE: Here's why you may be saving more in your 401(k) — and not even know it
SUMMARY: More employers have adopted "automatic escalation," which raises workers' 401(k) plan savings rate over time.

TITLE: A 20% down payment is 'definitely not required' to buy a house, economist says. Here's how much you need
SUMMARY: While coming up with a bigger down payment can help alleviate monthly homeownership costs, 20% is not required, experts say. Here's how much you need.

TITLE: This retirement account can be 'triple-tax efficient' for teens this summer, advisor says
SUMMARY: Roth individual retirement accounts for kids can offer triple-tax benefits. Here's what parents need to know about opening an IRA for their children.

TITLE: Elizabeth Warren wants more student loan borrowers to know bankruptcy is easier now
SUMMARY: Senator Elizabeth Warren wants the U.S. Department of Justice to do more to educate student loan borrowers about the new, easier path to filing for bankruptcy.
